value.body: The Legend of Paul Bunyan (1973; short)
value.text: The Legend of Paul Bunyan (1973; short)

paragraphs.body: Angel's first jobs in the industry included guest appearances in various Scooby Doo cartoons as well as in the series Super Friends, in which he played Hawkman; he also voiced Governor Wetworth on The Snorks, The Flash, and Samurai.
paragraphs.text: Angel's first jobs in the industry included guest appearances in various Scooby Doo cartoons as well as in the series Super Friends, in which he played Hawkman; he also voiced Governor Wetworth on The Snorks, The Flash, and Samurai.

paragraphs.body: In the Transformers series, he was the voice of Astrotrain, Ramjet, Omega Supreme, and Ultra Magnus, and also took over as Cyclonus following the death of Roger C. Carmel. He also lent his voice to the character Dr. Zachary Darret in the 1984 CBS cartoon series Pole Position. In 1995 he was the voice of Nikki in Balto, an animated film produced by Universal Studios and Amblin Entertainment, and also appeared in Dino-riders and G.I. Joe. In these three cartoons, he often acted alongside Frank Welker, Chris Latta, Peter Cullen, and Charlie Adler. He also voices the SWATbots on Sonic the Hedgehog, and played the voice of Liquidator on Darkwing Duck. Angel played the Chief of Police in Goof Troop and also voiced Nick Fury on Spider-Man: The Animated series.
paragraphs.text: In the Transformers series, he was the voice of Astrotrain, Ramjet, Omega Supreme, and Ultra Magnus, and also took over as Cyclonus following the death of Roger C. Carmel. He also lent his voice to the character Dr. Zachary Darret in the 1984 CBS cartoon series Pole Position. In 1995 he was the voice of Nikki in Balto, an animated film produced by Universal Studios and Amblin Entertainment, and also appeared in Dino-riders and G.I. Joe. In these three cartoons, he often acted alongside Frank Welker, Chris Latta, Peter Cullen, and Charlie Adler. He also voices the SWATbots on Sonic the Hedgehog, and played the voice of Liquidator on Darkwing Duck. Angel played the Chief of Police in Goof Troop and also voiced Nick Fury on Spider-Man: The Animated series.

paragraphs.body: In 2001, Angel was the voice of Teddy in the movie A.I. Artificial Intelligence. He later provided additional voices in animated films such as A Bug's Life, Monsters, Inc., Ice Age: The Meltdown, Cars, Horton Hears a Who, and Toy Story, and later returned to voice Chunk in Toy Story 3. Angel has also ventured into video games, narrating the cult hit Killer7 and playing Wonkers the Watilla in Dreamfall: The Longest Journey, The Mayor in Ratchet & Clank, and Captain Teague in the video game version of Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End.
paragraphs.text: In 2001, Angel was the voice of Teddy in the movie A.I. Artificial Intelligence. He later provided additional voices in animated films such as A Bug's Life, Monsters, Inc., Ice Age: The Meltdown, Cars, Horton Hears a Who, and Toy Story, and later returned to voice Chunk in Toy Story 3. Angel has also ventured into video games, narrating the cult hit Killer7 and playing Wonkers the Watilla in Dreamfall: The Longest Journey, The Mayor in Ratchet & Clank, and Captain Teague in the video game version of Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End.

paragraphs.body: In 2007, he voiced an alien named Technorg on Ben 10 and Comrade Chaos on El Tigre: The Adventures of Manny Rivera.
paragraphs.text: In 2007, he voiced an alien named Technorg on Ben 10 and Comrade Chaos on El Tigre: The Adventures of Manny Rivera.

paragraphs.body: Jack Angel's popular radio programs have been heard on stations KMPC and KFI, Los Angeles.
